Text: "The Shadow Garden Revision Plan."

In order to ready ourselves for what will likely be
an increasingly intense battle with the Cult of
Diablos, we, the Shadow Garden, embarked upon a
revamping and optimization of our organization.

...Of course, given that it will not be possible to
confirm the tangible results of this plan in the
short termâ€”

No amount of deliberating will guarantee whether the
Garden Revision Plan itself will perform adequately
or not.

Nevertheless, so long as it serves our ultimate goal
of destroying the Cult of Diablos, we will continue
to press onward no matter how difficult the path!

Lady Alpha has set forth a plan to further refine
our current chain of command.

In concrete terms, this means the realms of work we
Seven Shadows each oversee and the division of
personnel assigned to them will be more clearly
defined.

"But it all feels so similar to how the Cult hides,
controlling the people of this world from the
shadows, that I can't bring myself to like it."
...What Lady Alpha said is true, in a sense.

But if it helps the Shadow Garden lurk in the
darkness and hunt shadows, then so be it!

I, Beta, will be coordinating the "information
section," which mainly looks into and, as needed,
interferes with movements in the normal world.

Aside from our activities in mainstream society, this
department's duties also include investigating
movements within the underworld outside of the Cultâ€”
such as, say, the Lawless City.

Unlike Zeta, we won't be using individual prowess to
ascertain the state of affairs so much as leveraging
our organizational strength to conduct thorough
inquiries, much as a newspaper would...

While Zeta and my relationship had always been one
of sharing data, part of the aim here is to also
make us cooperate more closely by clarifying our
respective roles.

Sigma and the other Numbers who excel at urban
legwork will now be officially placed under my
command as well.

...Having subordinates to lead does make me nervous,
but I have to do my best! That goes for Natsume Kafka
the novelist too!

As head of the "administrative section," I, Gamma,
will continue to raise operational funds through
Mitsugoshi, Ltd.

The immediate point of improvement for this section
is to optimize the flow of knowledge and data
obtained in the course of managerial operations
throughout the rest of the Garden.

I must be mindful to coordinate daily with not just
Iota and the other Numbers under my direct
supervision, but Epsilon and her "commando unit"
as well!

And then, by allowing promising recruits like 93
to take a central role in planning at Mitsugoshi
from an early stage...

...I can steadily cultivate the personnel that will
surely be necessary for the future growth of
both the Garden and Mitsugoshi itself!

I used to pretty much do everything, but with this
latest reorganization I was made leader of an
official "commando section."

The part about me doing whatever the Garden needs
hasn't changedâ€”

The major differences are that clear priority will be
given to search and rescue missions involving the
possessed, and that it will now be possible to
exercise greater discretion in the field.

But I'll continue my initial response work through my
activities as the pianist Shiron when taking a hand
in the operations of other sections, of course.

I've also arranged things so that the Numbers working
under me, like Chi and Omega, can be dispatched to
other sections as the situation demands!

Before we were jacks-of-all-trades who tried to do
everything, but now we'll be jacks-of-all-trades who
CAN do everything!

As the head of the intelligence section, my job
focuses on gathering info on the Cult of Diablos.

...Anyway, I'll basically be working solo, pretty
much like before. I have been told to interact
more closely with the others, though.

That said, I'm sure that as things heat up between us
and the Cult, there'll be more situations where one
person isn't enough.

I don't know if this whole plan is the best course of
action, to be honest... There may come a time when
I need to set different priorities than the Garden.

...So all I need to do is teach everybody how to play
hide-and-seek good?

Aye! Your prowess at hide-and-seek will prove
extremely useful in increasing the survival skills
of our operatives!
Wow, the "martial training section" is super easy!
I'll stop by sometimes and show you guys how to hide!
Sir! Yes, sir! Thank you, sir!

(The department in charge of drilling new recruits
and developing units for action in the field changed
greatly from being restructured as a "martial
training section"â€”)

(Namely due to the introduction of a specialized
curriculum of learning from Lady Delta's abilities.)

(While Lady Delta's combat skills, specifically her
hand-to-hand fighting, stand out overly much and
are on a level our trainees can't reference...)

(...her expertise at "hide-and-seek," which is useful
for stealth and danger avoidance, is something that
can be introduced now that we have a general training
curriculum.)
...A bigger budget and more research staff...

That's what a "research and development section"
requires...

We plan on approving an increased budget, but as for
more staff, for now the answer is no.

Why...?! There are experiments I need more
people for...!

Because you'll only make them into the subjects of
said experiments.
Well...of course I will.
After all...they have the bodies I need for my tests!
*sigh* I rest my case.

...I thought Gamma was bad...but you're just as much
of a miser...

Heehee, call me whatever you want. But that's how
it's going to be, so you'll carry on as before.
Fiiine... Anyway...I get more money... Heehee...

...Now is the time for steady progress in all areas
so that we can build the strength of the Garden!
